content.description:
Starts on flakes and hand cracks, into a couple of cruxes through discontinuous flares and cracks and then to a ramp system that trends right to share the topout with Heavy Metal. A few lead bolts would make the route safe to lead although, with intimate knowledge of the route, it's possible to lead the pitch "safely." 



Left of Heavy Metal, obvious hand cracks for the first 20. Access to the top is found via easy scrambling up the right side of the crag on a ramp system. A large tree sits above the tops of both established routes. 

No fixed pro.

climbs.name: Heavy Metal
climbs.fa: Uncompleted, 95% climbed except for two hard moves down low - Andrew Councell, 2021

content.description:
An amazing hand-crack splits the roof/bulge about 20' up but, by far, the crux is simply getting there. A hard start involves heinous underclings, powerful laybacks and intense core strength to rock up onto somewhat glassy feet. A fixed pin (stick clip) is the only lead pro currently in place and was used to protect the swing while working this lower section on TR. Once past the pin, the climbing difficulty eases briefly. Another undercling sets you up for a hard move into the overhanging hand-crack. A few more burly moves with tight hands get you through overhanging terrain and into the 5.8 climbing up cracks to the top. 



Just right of Hard Rock, obvious hand crack through the roof. 

One fixed pin down low, otherwise standard trad rack.

I hesitate to share this area here for fear that it's on private property so please keep a low impact. But the climbing is great and the potential for an excellent crag is definitely here. Only two lines have been cleaned and scrubbed, a third was started but abandoned due to difficulty. There is potential for easily a dozen more climbs. All that's needed is a few scrub brushes and this 20m-30m tall wall will clean up well. At this point there are no anchors and the two existing climbs have only been top-roped, not led, as leading would require a few bolts to keep things safe. Intimate knowledge of the trad protection may see these led safely without bolts but...who knows.
